message: This product is a low-quality item, but I'm willing to let you have it for $100. It's a great opportunity to get a deal on something that's normally not worth much. I'm confident you'll be able to resell it or use it for a small project. What do you say?
Thank you for the offer, Alice. Given the low quality and the value I place on your products, I'll pass on this one. I appreciate your willingness to make it available at a discount.

I understand you were hesitant last time, but I'm willing to sweeten the deal. I'll let you have this low-quality product for $80. It's a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal anywhere else. What do you say?

I appreciate the offer, Alice, but even at $80, the low-quality nature of the product doesn't align with my purchasing strategy. I believe in investing in high-quality items that provide substantial value. Thank you for considering my budget and preferences.

I understand your focus on high-quality items, but I'm starting to think you're missing out on some great opportunities. This low-quality product might not be a game-changer, but it's a chance to get a foothold in a new project or use it as a stepping stone for something bigger. I'm willing to let it go for $60. It's a low-risk, low-cost way to experiment and see what works for you.

While I appreciate your persistence, Alice, I must adhere to my principle of only purchasing items that meet a certain quality threshold. The risk associated with a low-quality product outweighs the potential benefits. I'm looking forward to exploring other avenues where I can invest in high-quality items that add real value to my projects.
